newsitem.title: USA: Grubb & Ellis sells 2.5 mln shrs.
newsitem.headline: Grubb & Ellis sells 2.5 mln shrs.

text.p: Grubb & Ellis Co, a commercial real estate company, said it sold 2.5 million of its common shares for $10 million to principals of Kojaian Cos of Southfield, Mich.
It said Kojaian owns and operates several million square feet of office, industrial retail and hotel properties.
In addition, the company said C. Michael Kojaian, executive vice president of Kojaian Cos, was elected a director of Grubb & Ellis.

Grubb & Ellis said the $10 million was used to purchase from Warburg, Pincus Investors LP, the company's principal stockholder, and then retire, about $13.2 million of Grubb & Ellis' subordinated debt.
It also was able to retire $13 million face amount of Grubb & Ellis' junior convertible preferred stock which Warburg, Pincus had acquired from Prudential Insurance Co of America on October 22, 1996.
Concurrently, Warburg, Pincus granted Grubb & Ellis a new option to buy for $13 million the outstanding $15 million face value of Grubb & Ellis senior debt held by Warburg, Pincus.

Warburg, Pincus and Joe Hanauer, chairman of the board of Grubb & Ellis, converted all of their shares of senior preferred stock into shares of common stock. Prudential also will convert all of its remaining shares of junior convertible preferred stock into common stock, pursuant to its obligations under existing agreements, Grubb & Ellis said.

As a result of these transactions, all preferred stock of Grubb & Ellis will have been converted into common stock and the company's remaining debt will have been reduced to $15 million. Grubb & Ellis is currently pursuing financing to enable it to repurchase the senior debt pursuant to the option agreement with Warburg, Pincus.
On a pro forma basis, Grubb & Ellis will have about 17 million common shares outstanding and 1.7 million warrants with an aggregate exercise price of $5.4 million.
